title: Bug 121974: Can't evaluate global expressions when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop
description: Bug 121974: Can't evaluate global expressions when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop. For global expressions, such as {params["p1"]}, {new DateTime()}, it should always be available and evaluatable within the BIRT scripting environment. Currently, Dte scriptExpression has three types: BEFOREFIRSTROW, AFTERLASTROW, ONEACHROW.
OB: Global expressions, such as {params["p1"]}, {new DateTime()}, are currently not available for evaluation when ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop.
EB: Global expressions should be available and return a correct result value whenever they are evaluated within the BIRT scripting environment. To achieve this, a new GLOBAL expression type is required to ensure their availability regardless of the iteration loop status.
SR: To reproduce the issue, attempt to evaluate global expressions, such as {params["p1"]} or {new DateTime()}, when the ResultIterator is not in the iteration loop. This will result in a 'QueryResults or its iterator has been closed' DataException, even though these global expressions are not directly related to the data row iteration.
